film_condensed: 1967 - height of cold war.
Russian spy Abel paints in a studio, gets a call.
reality_condensed: Abel set himself up as an artist in Brooklyn.

film_condensed: Leaves his studio, tailed by the FBI.
Sits painting by the riverside.
Covertly removes a coin from underneath a bench.
reality_condensed: A hollow nickel was a key piece of evidence.

film_condensed: Goes home, pries coin open - there's a note inside.
reality_condensed: Tiny notes showing groups of numbers were found.

film_condensed: The FBI burst in. Abel destroys the note.
reality_condensed: Abel was naked when they arrested him in his hotel.

film_condensed: Insurance lawyer Donovan discusses a claim with fellow lawyer.
Returns to his office, his name on the door.
reality_condensed: Donovan was a partner in Watters & Donovan law firm.

film_condensed: Watters asks him to take Abel's case. He agrees.
reality_condensed: The bar recommended Donovan take the case.

film_condensed: Donovan asks his associate, Forrester, to help.
Donovan argues with wife Mary about the case.
reality_condensed: Mary wasn't happy about the case.

film_condensed: He visits Abel, who accepts his representation.
Captain Powers undergoes CIA recruitment protocol.
Agent Williams recruits Powers & others.
Donovan requests a trial extension, Judge Byers refuses.
Agent Hoffman accosts Donovan in the street.
Hoffman asks Donovan for info on Abel. He refuses.
Powers is shown the U-2 spy plane he'll be flying.
reality_condensed: The U-2 mission was based at Peshawar.

film_condensed: Donovan views evidence against Abel. There was no search warrant.
Byers denies Donovan's motion to throw out illegally-obtained evidence.
Abel asks Donovan how the case is going.
A classroom of kids are shown an atomic attack infofilm.
reality_condensed: Kids were shown civil defence advice films.

film_condensed: Donovan's son Roger is concerned about everything.
reality_condensed: True, but for Spielberg, not Donovan.

film_condensed: Donovan gets glared at on the subway.
Abel is found guilty on all counts.
Abel & Donovan talk. They like each other.
Donovan visits Byers at home, asks that Abel live.
reality_condensed: Donovan presented this argument in open court.

film_condensed: Byers sentences Abel to 30 years.
Donovan tells journalists he'll be appealing.
People have thrown glass into Donovan's office in protest.
Donovan & Abel listen to music in custody.
reality_condensed: Donovan visited Abel often, discussed everything.

film_condensed: Shots are fired into Donovan's home.
The police arrive, an officer yells at Donovan.
CIA recruits are told to kill themselves in the event of capture.
reality_condensed: Spies were given a poisoned needle in a hollow silver dollar.

film_condensed: Donovan heads to the Supreme Court.
reality_condensed: Donovan took Abel's case to The Supreme Court.

film_condensed: The CIA spies head out on their mission.
reality_condensed: The CIA sent a plane to photograph Soviet territory.

film_condensed: Donovan gives a speech to the Supreme Court.
reality_condensed: Donovan took Abel's case to The Supreme Court.

film_condensed: CIA spies conduct pre-flight checks, Powers is piloting.
Donovan continues his speech.
reality_condensed: Donovan took Abel's case to The Supreme Court.

film_condensed: Powers takes off.
reality_condensed: Powers flew the U-2 from Peshawar.

film_condensed: Donovan's speech has everyone listening.
reality_condensed: Donovan took Abel's case to The Supreme Court.

film_condensed: The U-2 is shot down. Powers opens his parachute.
Abel hears his conviction was upheld by 5 to 4.
reality_condensed: The court affirmed the verdict by a vote of 5 to 4.

film_condensed: Mary hears the same news.
reality_condensed: The family were relieved when it was over.

film_condensed: Donovan gets a letter from East Germany in with his usual hatemail.
reality_condensed: Donovan got hatemail, & letters from Germany.

film_condensed: The letter is from someone posing as Abel's wife.
reality_condensed: Donovan received letters from Abel's fake wife.

film_condensed: Powers gets 10 years from the Russian govt.
CIA director Dulles asks Donovan to negotiate a prisoner exchange.
reality_condensed: Donovan was asked to negotiate a prisoner exchange.

film_condensed: Berlin - the wall is going up. Pryor, a student, slips through a gap.
reality_condensed: Pryor wasn't in Berlin when the wall was under construction.

film_condensed: Pryor finds his girlfriend, implores her to leave with him.
reality_condensed: Pryor didn't have a girlfriend in Berlin.

film_condensed: They get trapped, the police arrest Pryor.
Donovan packs to leave, his wife is scared.
reality_condensed: Donovan didn't tell his wife the truth.

film_condensed: Berlin - Donovan told he will be working alone.
Hoffman warns Donovan of the dangers in East Berlin.
reality_condensed: Donovan stayed in an apartment, briefed by 'Bob'.

film_condensed: Pryor's girlfriend tries to visit him in jail.
reality_condensed: Pryor didn't have a girlfriend in Berlin.

film_condensed: Donovan persuades guards to let him skip a checkpoint line.
A gang of boys steal Donovan's coat.
Donovan meets Abel's 'family' at the Russian Embassy.
Donovan negotiates with Soviet Secretary Schischkin.
Lawyer Vogel agrees to exchange Pryor for Abel.
Donovan briefs Hoffman on his progress.
Powers interrogated by the Soviets.
Agents wake Abel in his cell.
reality_condensed: Abel was brought to Berlin for the exchange.

film_condensed: Moscow agrees to the exchange of Abel for Powers.
Vogel is now refusing the exchange of Abel for Pryor.
reality_condensed: The DDR had issues with the double trade.

film_condensed: The police pull Vogel & Donovan over.
The police take Donovan away, citing passport problems.
Donovan spends the night in jail.
reality_condensed: Donovan didn't spend any time in jail.

film_condensed: From the train he sees would-be escapees getting shot.
Hoffman tells him the Germans called. Donovan rushes off.
Donovan meets East German AG Ott, who offers him Pryor only.
Donovan tells Ott's assistant to pass on a tough message.
Donovan's insistence on saving both Pryor & Powers makes Hoffman mad.
Donovan calls Mary, says he's in London.
The exchange is confirmed. Powers at Glienicke Bridge, Pryor at Checkpoint Charlie.
reality_condensed: The complicated exchange was confirmed by phone.

film_condensed: Donovan's party waits at Glienicke Bridge.
reality_condensed: The exchange happened at Glienicke Bridge.

film_condensed: They call Checkpoint Charlie to see if Pryor is there.
reality_condensed: The guards phoned for updated from Checkpoint Charlie.

film_condensed: The other side arrive. Donovan sticks by Abel.
reality_condensed: Donovan saw Abel off across the bridge.

film_condensed: Donovan insists they wait for confirmation of Pryor's arrival.
reality_condensed: They waited for Pryor to get to Checkpoint Charlie.

film_condensed: Pryor arrives at Checkpoint Charlie.
reality_condensed: Pryor was released at Checkpoint Charlie.

film_condensed: Abel tells Donovan he's sent him a painting.
reality_condensed: Donovan watched the exchange. Abel gave him a painting.

film_condensed: Powers tries to thank people, nobody listens.
Donovan unwraps the painting, it's a portrait of him.
Donovan arrives home, his wife asks for her marmalade.
Donovan's family hear what he's been up to when it hits the news.
Mary finds Donovan fast asleep, she's proud.
Donovan on the subway, now respected by strangers.
Abel reunited with his real family.
reality_condensed: Abel went back to his family.

film_condensed: Powers died in a crash, awarded posthumous accolades.
reality_condensed: Powers got bravery awards, died in helicopter crash.

film_condensed: Pryor became Professor Emeritus at Swarthmore College.
Donovan sent to Cuba to negotiate for prisoners.
reality_condensed: Donovan negotiated for Bay of Pigs prisoners.
